      • findElement

        protected org.openqa.selenium.WebElement findElement(java.lang.String element)
        This method demonstrates findElement().
        Find the first WebElement using the given method. See the note in findElements(By)
        about finding via XPath. This method is affected by the 'implicit wait' times in
        force at the time of execution. The findElement(..) invocation will return a matching row,
        or try again repeatedly until the configured timeout is reached. findElement should not be
        used to look for non-present elements, use findElements(By) and assert zero length response
        instead. "Type" is appended to the elementName to find the type of element that is being requested.
        EXAMPE: searchField=//input[@name='q']
        searchFieldType=xpath

        EXCEPTIONS: If no "Type" resource is defined for the element, xpath will be selected.

        Parameters:
        element - from the pages properties file.
        Returns:
        WebElement if found null otherwise
        See Also:
        WebDriver, WebElement

      • findElements

        protected java.util.List<org.openqa.selenium.WebElement> findElements(java.lang.String element)
        This methodemonstrates findElements().
        Find the list of WebElements using the given method. See the note in findElements(By)
        about finding via XPath. This method is affected by the 'implicit wait' times in
        force at the time of execution. The findElement(..) invocation will return a matching row,
        or try again repeatedly until the configured timeout is reached. findElement should not be
        used to look for non-present elements, use findElements(By) and assert zero length response
        instead. "Type" is appended to the elementName to find the type of element that is being requested.
        EXAMPE: searchField=//input[@name='q']
        searchFieldType=xpath

        EXCEPTIONS: If no "Type" resource is defined for the element, xpath will be selected.

        Parameters:
        element - from the pages properties file.
        Returns:
        theList if found null otherwise
        See Also:
        WebDriver, WebElement

      • verifyTableContent

        public boolean verifyTableContent(java.lang.String searchFor,
                                  java.util.List<org.openqa.selenium.WebElement> tr_collection,
                                  java.lang.String colElements,
                                  java.lang.String matchType)
        This method Demonstrates verifyTableContent(). This method searches the columns in a given list of data.
        Parameters:
        searchFor - - the string to find in the table
        tr_collection - - the rows of data
        colElements - - column element
        matchType - - EXACT/CONTAINS
        Returns:
        true of searchFor was found, false otherwise
        See Also:
        WebDriver, WebElement

      • validateElementText

        private void validateElementText(java.lang.String element)
        This method demonstrates validateElementText(). ValidateElementText will look in the properties file for the text related to a specific element. Read the element text from the properties file and then try to validate it on the page
        Parameters:
        element - web element to verify in the properties file
        See Also:
        WebDriver, WebElement
